Combining and Customizing Effects: You can combine different effects and particles to create complex and beautiful visual effects. The mod also provides a wide range of settings and options, allowing you to fine-tune each effect to your liking.
Animation and Sound Support: ParticleLibrary allows you to add animation and sounds to your particles, making them even more realistic and impressive. You can customize the playback animation, playback speed, animation loops and add sound effects to create a complete experience.

name: Teleport All NPC Home
description:
Teleport All NPC Home is a mod for tModLoader that adds a convenient feature to teleport all NPCs to their homes in the game Terraria. This mod allows you to easily move all NPCs into place, which can be useful during construction or when you want to reorganize your base.

Teleport all NPCs: The mod adds a new button in the game interface that allows you to teleport all NPCs to their homes with one click. After activating this button, all NPCs are automatically moved to their respective houses.
User-friendly interface: The mod provides a simple and intuitive interface where you can activate the NPC teleportation function. The interface can be opened by pressing a special button or keyboard shortcut.
Customization: The mod also allows you to customize some aspects of the functionality. You can choose which NPCs will teleport and which ones will remain in place. This is especially useful if you have specific requirements or if you want to control the placement of NPCs in your base.
Compatibility with other mods: The Teleport All NPC Home mod is compatible with other Terraria mods, allowing you to use it in conjunction with expanded NPC sets or customized homes.

name: Census - Town NPC Checklist
description:
Census - Town NPC Checklist provides a convenient way for the player to keep track of the NPCs in their town and control which NPCs still need to be recruited. This is especially useful in the game Terraria, where the player must ensure certain NPCs are present to gain access to various items and services.

Mod functions:

NPC List Interface: The mod adds a new interface where the player can see a list of all NPCs available in the game and mark those they have already attracted to their city.
NPC status display: Each NPC in the list is indicated by an icon and a name. Next to each name, the status of the NPC is displayed, indicating whether he is attracted to the city or not.
Hints and Requirements: For each NPC in the list, the mod provides the hints and requirements necessary to attract him. This helps the player understand what conditions must be met in order for the NPC to appear.
NPC Filters: The mod allows the player to apply filters to the list of NPCs to quickly find the characters they need. Filters can include NPC type, attraction status, and other parameters.
Updates and Expansions: The Census - Town NPC Checklist Mod is updated regularly to keep track of NPC changes and additions to the game. This ensures that the NPC list is always up to date.
Synchronization with multiplayer: If the game is played in multiplayer mode, the mod allows you to synchronize the list of NPCs between players so that all participants see the same NPC information.
Customizable Options: The Census - Town NPC Checklist mod provides customizable options that allow the player to customize the appearance and functionality of the NPC Checklist interface to suit their preferences.
The list of NPCs available in the game will depend on the version of Terraria installed on your computer and other mods installed. The Census - Town NPC Checklist mod will display all available NPCs, including original NPCs from Terraria and NPCs added by other mods.

name: Which Mod Is This From? (WMITF)
description:
Which Mod Is This From? (WMITF) is a mod for TModLoader in Terraria that provides players with a convenient tool to determine which mod items, blocks, and other game elements come from.

"Which Mod Is This From?" (WMITF) for TModLoader is a specific mod created for Terraria that is designed to help players determine which mod (from the list of installed ones) a particular game element, item, monster, etc. comes from. This mod usually provides information about the origin of objects in the game so that players can easily identify which mod added the item.

With WMITF you can quickly identify which mod a certain element in a Terraria game comes from, which can be useful for managing and organizing your installed mods.

name: Where's My Items
description:
"Where's My Items" is a mod for TModLoader that adds a convenient item search feature to Terraria. This mod is especially useful in cases where you have a lot of items in your inventory or when you can't find a specific item.

Search by name: The mod allows you to search for items by their name. You can simply start typing the name of an item and the mod will automatically display items that match your input.
Filter by Category: You can also filter items by category to make your search easier. For example, you can select a category of weapons, tools, armor, etc. to see only items that belong to the selected category.
Hints: The mod offers hints when searching for items. If you dont know the full name of an item, you can enter only part of the name and the mod will suggest options that match your input.
Quick Access to Items: Once you find an item you want, you can click on it to automatically move it to your inventory or quick access bar. This allows you to quickly get the item you need without having to manually search for it in your inventory.
Multiplayer Support: Wheres My Items mod also supports multiplayer so you can use it while playing with your friends. You can easily share items and help other players find the things they need.

name: WikiThis
description:
"WikiThis" is a mod for TModLoader that provides quick and easy access to information from the official Terraria wiki page. It allows players to access information about items, blocks, bosses, NPCs and more right in the game, without having to leave the game to search for information on the Internet.

List of functions of the WikiThis mod:

Quickly access information about items, blocks, bosses, NPCs and more from the game.
Integration with the official wiki page of the Terraria game, which allows you to get up-to-date and accurate information.
A simple and user-friendly interface that allows you to quickly and easily find the information you need.
The ability to obtain information about items, even if they have not yet been found in the game.
The ability to obtain information about things that can be created through crafting or with the help of NPCs.

name: Teleport to pylons from anywhere!
description:
"Teleport to pylons from anywhere!" is a mod for Tmodloader that allows players to teleport to pylons from any distance on the map, they just need to have another pylon in their inventory.

Description and features of the mod:

The player can teleport to any pylon on the map by clicking on the “Teleport to pylon” button in the special interface.
To use this feature, you must have at least one pylon in your inventory. If the player has several pylons of different types, he can choose which pylon to teleport to.
This feature is available anywhere on the map, even if the player is in a different biome or on a different island.
This mod is compatible with other mods and does not affect gameplay.
List of pylons to which you can teleport using this mod:

Forest Pylon
Desert Pylon
Snow Pylon
Ocean Pylon
Mushroom Pylon
Jungle Pylon
Hallow Pylon
Crimson Pylon
Corruption Pylon
Thus, this mod makes it easier to move around the map and saves players time by allowing them to quickly move between pylons anywhere in the world of Terraria.

name: Armor Modifiers & Reforging
description:
Armor Modifiers & Reforging is a mod for TModLoader that adds new armor modifiers and item upgrades to Terraria.

List of Armor Modifiers:

Agitating: Increases attack speed by 5%
Armored: Increases defense by 4
Brisk: Increases movement speed by 4%
Celestial: Increases magic defense by 4 and maximum mana by 20
Frenzied: Increases damage by 5%
Hard: Increases maximum health by 4
Lucky: Increases item drop chance by 2%
Menacing: Increases damage by 4%
Quick: Increases attack speed by 5%
Warding: increases defense by 8
These modifiers can be obtained using the item re-modification technique, but they cannot be applied to clothing that already has a modifier.

List of item improvements:

Godly: Increases damage by 15%
Demonic: Increases damage by 10%
Ruthless: Increases damage by 10% and reduces defense by 5
Deadly: Increases damage by 7%
Unreal: Increases damage by 5% and attack speed by 15%
Superior: Increases damage by 5%
Masterful: Increases damage by 3%
Adept: Increases damage by 2%
These upgrades can be applied to most weapons and some accessories to increase damage and effectiveness in combat. Item upgrades can also be re-upgraded using the re-upgrade tool.

The Armor Modifiers & Reforging mod allows players to create stronger gear and have more fun playing Terraria.

name: Boss Cursor
description:
Boss Cursor is a modification for the game Terraria that adds a cursor for easier battles with bosses. This mod allows players to track the location of the boss on the screen and easily control the direction of the attack.

Some of the features of the Boss Cursor mod include:

A cursor that displays the location of the boss on the players screen.
Various cursor settings to customize for different bosses.
Ability to resize the cursor to match the size of the boss.
Modes to display information about bosses, including health, name and other details.
Compatible with various bosses from Terraria.
Some bosses that the Boss Cursor mod is compatible with include:

Eye of Cthulhu
Eater of Worlds
Skeletron (Skeletron)
Queen Bee
Wall of Flesh
Twins
The Destroyer
Skeletron Prime (Skeletron Prime)
Plantera
Golem
Duke Fishron
Lunatic Cultist
Moon Lord
Overall, the Boss Cursor mod is a useful addition for Terraria players who want more precise control over their attack and movement in boss battles.

name: Auto Trash Jopojelly
description:
Auto Trash is a mod for tModLoader in Terraria that allows you to automatically trash items to free up inventory space.

Once the mod is installed, a new button appears in the top right corner of the inventory called "Auto Trash". Clicking this button opens a window where you can add items that should be automatically thrown into the trash when they go into inventory.

List of some features of Auto Trash mod:

Adding items to the automatic deletion list.
Removing items from the automatic deletion list.
Ignore mode for items that should not be discarded automatically, even if they are on the list.
Ability to switch between lists of items in different game modes, such as solo or multiplayer.
Clear List button to easily remove all items from the automatic deletion list.
Auto Trash mod can be very useful for players who often collect a lot of items and are overloaded with inventory. This can also be useful to avoid accidentally throwing away important items such as ores or jewelry.

name: Auto Reforge
description:
Auto Reforge is a mod for the game Terraria that is available through Tmodloader. It is designed to automatically reforge the player's items in the blacksmith's shop to increase their stats.

List of features of the Auto Reforge mod:

Automatic reforging: the mod will automatically reforge all available items from the blacksmith to a better reforging.
Ignore certain items: You can configure the mod to not reforge certain items.
Setting priorities: You can set reforging priorities for different types of items, such as weapons, armor, or accessories.
Preserve Previous Settings: The mod saves previous reforging settings for each item, so players can easily return to them if they wish.
Settings Interface: The mod has a user-friendly settings interface that allows you to configure various settings.
The list of items that can be reforged using the Auto Reforge mod includes:

All types of weapons (swords, bows, guns, etc.)
Armor (helmets, breastplates, leggings)
Accessories (rings, necklaces, coats, etc.)
Tools (axes, picks, shovels)
Auto Reforge is a useful mod for players who want to improve their Terraria gaming experience by allowing them to quickly and efficiently increase their item stats.

name: Russifier of Project tRU
description:
Mod mods are an important part of the gameplay for players who don't speak English. Below are some of the mods for the tRU project, for which there is a crack.

What mods have our team translated so far?

Calamity (Project tRU)
Fargo Mutant (Project tRU)
Fargo Souls (Project tRU)
Infernum Mode (Project tRU)
Clicker Class (built into mod)
Boss Checklist (built into mod)
Catalyst Mod (built into mod)
Thorium (Project tRU) New!
What mod translations will there be in the future?

100% will be transferred to Starlight River and Endless Escapade
When will there be a translation of The Stars Above / Redemption or X mod?
Translation of new mods will begin after the release of 1.4.4 tmod. Now there is no point in starting to translate and wasting time on it. In this version, tmod developers radically changed their approach to mod localization. With the new system, translation will become much easier, and this will allow you to add new translations of mods to the crack without much time investment.

name: Structure Helper
description:
Structure Helper is a mod for TModLoader that adds convenient tools for creating and placing structures in the world of the Terraria game. With this mod you can easily create, save and load structures that can be used to decorate your world or to create complex structures.

Main functions of the mod:

Creating structures: you can create structures from any blocks in the game using special tools that are added by the mod.
Editing Structures: Once a structure is created, you can edit it by adding, deleting or changing blocks.
Saving Structures: You can save the structures you create and use them in the future.
Loading Structures: You can load saved structures and place them in the game world.
Placement Tools: The mod adds several tools that allow you to accurately place structures in the game world.
Structure bundles: You can create structure bundles, which can contain multiple structures, and load them all at once.
Additionally, the Structure Helper mod adds several additional features such as support for complex blocks (such as multi-component blocks), the ability to copy and paste structures, and much more.

List of main functions:

Creating structures
Editing structures
Preservation of structures
Loading structures
Placement Tools
Structure Kits
Complex block support
Copying and pasting structures.
Overall, the Structure Helper mod is a powerful tool for creating and placing structures in the world of Terraria. If you like building and decorating in the game, then this mod can be very useful for you.

name: Subworld Library
description:
Subworld Library is a mod for TModLoader that allows players to create underground worlds using various tools and items. This mod adds new blocks and items that can be used to create complex and beautiful underground landscapes.

Mini Map: This feature allows players to view a map of their underground world, making it easier to explore and navigate.
Sunbeam: This tool allows players to create beams of light that can penetrate blocks and illuminate underground landscapes.
Colorful Lights: These lights allow players to decorate their underworld with colorful lighting.
Portals: These items allow players to create portals between different underground worlds.
Various Blocks: Subworld Library adds many new blocks that can be used to create beautiful underground landscapes such as crystals, stalactites and stalagmites.
Various Items: The mod also adds new items that can be used to improve the underground world, such as tools for creating and removing blocks, as well as new types of weapons and armor.
This is just a small list of what is available in the Subworld Library. The modification is great for players who want to create beautiful and unique underground worlds in Terraria.

name: Ore Excavator (Veinminer)
description:
Ore Excavator - The Successor to Vein Miner (Ore Excavator is the successor to the Vein Miner mod) is a modification for the game Terraria, which is available through the tModLoader platform.
The main function of the mod is the ability to mine blocks in large quantities with a single press of a button. This allows you to quickly collect resources and frees players from having to mine each block separately.

Here is a list of the main features of Ore Excavator:

Automatic mining of blocks: When using a suitable tool and holding down a button (default - left mouse button), the mod will automatically mine all blocks around the selected block. This allows you to quickly mine resources and clear large areas of land.
Configurable block list: The mod allows you to configure the list of blocks that will be mined automatically. Users can add or remove blocks from the list to customize it to their needs.
Multiple Tool Support: The mod supports a variety of tools including picks, axes, and shovels. Users can choose the appropriate tool to mine each block.
Customizable Radius: Users can customize the mods radius to mine blocks in a wide or narrow radius around the selected block.
Various settings: The mod allows you to configure various parameters such as mining speed, delay between mining blocks and others.
Compatibility with other mods: Ore Excavator is compatible with most other Terraria mods and can be used simultaneously with them.
The Ore Excavator - The Successor to Vein Miner mod is a useful tool for mining resources in Terraria. It greatly speeds up the mining process and allows players to concentrate on other aspects of the game, such as building and combat.

name: Pylons Prevent Evils
description:
Pylons Prevent Evils (PPE) is a mod for tModLoader that adds a new mechanism to the game to protect villages from destructive events such as invasions or summoning bosses.

Features:

Addition of a new item called the "Pylon Key", which allows the player to activate pylon defenses in the village.
When protection is activated, all pylons in the village will be protected from enemies and troubles.
Village defense will also be automatically activated if the player starts a battle inside the village.
If the player has a Pylon Key, a marker will be displayed on the map indicating a protected village.
The mod also adds a new mechanic that allows the player to cancel the villages pylon defenses if they choose to do so.
Functions:

Addition of a new item “Pylon Key”, which activates the protection of pylons in the village.
Adding a new mechanic that allows the player to cancel the protection of pylons in the village.
Automatic activation of protection at the start of a battle inside a village.
Display a marker on the map indicating a protected village.
Ability to configure mod parameters through a configuration file.
Pylons Prevent Evils is a great mod for those who want to protect their villages from destructive events in the game. The mod adds a new item, mechanics and settings that will help players make the game more convenient and secure.

name: Smarter Cursor
description:
Smarter Cursor is a mod for tModLoader that improves the cursor and adds some additional features for the player's convenience.

Here are some of its features:

Improved cursor: The mod changes the appearance of the cursor and adds new animations to make it more vibrant and interesting.
Improved cursor movement: The mod allows you to move the cursor more accurately and quickly, making the game smoother.
Beautiful Effects: The mod adds new effects when you hover over various objects, which makes the game more visually appealing.
Various settings: The mod allows you to customize many aspects of the cursor, such as its color, transparency and shape.
Additional Features: The mod adds several additional features such as the ability to copy and paste text in the game, change the scale of the interface, and also adds new shortcuts to the minimap.
Compatibility with other mods: The mod is compatible with many other tModLoader mods, allowing players to use Smarter Cursor with other modifications and additions.
Overall, Smarter Cursor is a useful and convenient mod that improves the gameplay and makes the game more enjoyable for players.

name: Quality of Terraria
description:
Quality of Life (QoL) is a mod for the game Terraria that adds various functional and user-friendly interface elements that improve the player's quality of life.

Here is a list of some of these features:

Quickly Move Items - Allows you to quickly move items from your inventory to the ground or another container, such as a box or chest.
Fast recovery of health and mana - allows you to quickly use restorative items without opening your inventory.
Improved inventory - adds a new inventory interface with more convenient sorting and a quick search function.
Automatic Equipment - Allows you to automatically equip the best available weapons and armor.
Automatic use of accessories - allows you to automatically use accessories with positive effects, such as speeding up movement or increasing attack power.
Quick Block Destroy - Allows you to quickly destroy blocks, such as dirt or rock, with a single button press.
Automatic hacking - allows you to automatically hack chests and boxes without requiring additional tools.
Improved item collection mode - allows you to easily collect items located near the player.
Instant Boss Spawn - Allows you to quickly spawn bosses without having to search for the appropriate items.
Improved NPC search - allows you to quickly find the desired NPC using the search function.
These are just a few of the many features available in the Quality of Life mod for Terraria. They allow you to make the gaming process more convenient and efficient, saving the player’s time and effort.

name: Magic Storage
description:
Magic Storage is a mod for TModLoader in the Terraria game that adds automatic and organized access to items and inventory. This mod allows players to install vaults that automatically sort and store items in the game, making inventory management much easier.

List of storages added by the Magic Storage mod:

Storage Heart is the foundation for organizing storage. It is installed first and serves as the basis for the rest of the storage.
Storage Units are basic storage units that can store many items. They can be upgraded to have more capacity and various features such as quick access to items and automatic sorting.
The Crafting Interface is a repository that gives players access to materials and recipes for crafting items.
Crafting Storage is an advanced variant of the Crafting Interface that can also store and organize items needed for crafting.
Item Collector is a device that automatically collects items dropped from mobs and blocks. It can also be configured to collect certain items.
Item Router is a device that automatically redirects items from one storage to another depending on specified conditions. It can be used to automatically sort items in storage areas.
Remote Storage Access is a device that allows players to access their storage from anywhere in the world, just by having an active Storage Heart.
All of these storages can be configured to work with different items and materials, and can be easily rearranged and modified depending on the players needs. Magic Storage greatly simplifies gameplay by allowing players to focus on exploring and crafting rather than managing their inventory.

name: Recipe Browser
description:
Recipe Browser is a mod for the game Terraria that adds a convenient tool for searching and viewing recipes for items in the game.

Recipe search: The mod adds a search box where you can enter the name of an item or material and it will display all recipes that use that item or material.
Recipe information: You can get detailed information about each recipe, such as the crafting requirements, the materials needed to craft the item, and where you can find the materials.
Convenient inventory view: The mod also adds the ability to view your entire inventory without having to open it every time. You can select the item you want and see what recipes can be made from it.
Recipe history: The mod also keeps a history of all the recipes youve viewed, making it easy to come back to them later.
Filters: You can filter recipes by various categories such as items that can be crafted, items that can be used as materials, and so on.
Integration with other mods: The mod is compatible with most other mods, allowing you to see the recipes created by those mods.
Overall, Recipe Browser is a very useful mod for those who want to get the most out of Terraria. It simplifies the crafting process and allows you to quickly find information about items in the game.

name: Boss Checklist
description:
Boss Checklist is a mod for Terraria that adds an interface for tracking and managing bosses that are available in the game.

The main functions:

Shows a list of all bosses and events in the game, as well as information about them.
Allows you to track the progress and settings of each boss, including the number of wins, the last win, and the difficulty of the fight.
Contains many settings to customize the interface and boss settings.
Has integration with other mods like Calamity and Thorium.
Boss list:

Eye of Cthulhu
Eater of Worlds
Brain of Cthulhu
skeleton
Queen bee
Wall of flesh
The Twins
the destroyer
Skeletron prime
Plant
G
Duke fishron
Lunatic Cultist
Moon lord
Empress of Light
queen slime
Supreme Calamitas (for integration with Calamity Mod)
The Ragnarök (for integration with Thorium Mod)
In addition, the mod contains information about events such as Blood Moon, Eclipse, Pumpkin Moon and Frost Moon, and additional battles such as Duke Fishron (wing size) and Moon Lord (fair fight).

name: Jojos Caesar Sound
description:
JojosCaesarSound
This mod, named JojosCaesarSound, enhances the gaming experience in Terraria by adding a new sound effect. When a player is hit by a Boulder, the SHIZAAAAAAAAAAAA meme will start playing.

Compatibility
This mod is compatible with tModLoader v2024.1.3.0 and Terraria v1.4.4.9

name: Calamity Mod v2.0.1.3
description:

	27 bosses and 12 minibosses
	100+ enemies
	5 city NPCs

	1800+ items

	50+ vanilla mechanic changes
	30+ new vanilla item recipes
	Over 450 tweaks and improvements to vanilla items.

name: Overhaul v5.0
description:
This is only a beta version of the Overhaul mod for Terraria 1.4 so far, so there are bugs and imperfections. But now you can download the mod and test it. According to the authors of the mod, this version is about 60%+ ready.

What is the Terraria Overhaul mod
This is a huge mod that, instead of adding new content to the game, focuses on adding new game mechanics and completely overhauling existing ones.

name: Bizarre Adventure v0.0.6.1
description:
New version of TBA (Terrarian Bizarre Adventure) mod for Terraria 1.4. Mod (jojo mod) adds stands, abilities and items from the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure universe to Terraria.
Stands that are in fashion:
Star platinum
The World
King Crimson
Aerosmith

name: Night's Conversion
description:
What is Night's Conversion?
Night's Conversion allows you to use the properties of every sword that went into the Night's Edge. When using Night's Conversion, you can craft 3 new swords, each of which have some relation to one of the swords that went into the Night's Edge. The regular Night's Edge is assumed to be the Light's Bane version for this mod.

What does Night's Conversion add?
The first sword added is the Night's Katana. The Night's Katana has the added ability of autoswing, inherited from the Muramasa. While swinging the sword, monster spawns are also increased, due to the fact that you receive the Water Candle debuff.
The second sword added is the Night's Jungle. The Night's Jungle has the ability to poison enemies on contact, inherited from the Blade of Grass. Unlike the Blade of Grass, the Poisoned debuff is applied 100% of the time and lasts for 3 seconds.
The third sword added is the Night's Flame. The Night's Flame has the ability to burn enemies on contact, inherited from the Fiery Greatsword. The On Fire! debuff is always applied for 3 seconds.

name: The Polarities v0.8.1.4
description:
The authors of The Polarities mod focused on adding new bosses to Terraria. At the same time, they emphasize the quality and compliance of the bosses with the vanilla style of play. Now in this mod there are 8 new bosses, new weapons, armor and other items.

Details about bosses

The polarities
A couple of bosses that always remain on opposite sides of the player. They drop several powerful weapons and materials to create a unique set of armor, as well as a useful exclusive accessory for experts. Designed to fight after the golem.
Sun pixie
A giant pixie that bombards the player with lasers and deadly beams. Drops several solar-themed weapons useful for mechanical bosses. Designed to fight up to furs.

Storm Cloudfish
An early rain boss that drops several useful early game accessories and a rain switch. Designed to fight up to EoC.

Eclipxie
A much more difficult version of the Sun Pixie that fought during a solar eclipse. Some of his drops are enhancements to the Sun Pixie drops, while others are more unique. Designed to fight after the golem.

Gigabat
A massive cavern-fighting bat that summons a swarm of minions to defend itself and attack the player. Uniquely, it is triggered by the release of gems (crafted from gems and fireflies) in the cave layer. The more gems are released and the higher the level of the stone from which they are made, the faster the bat will arrive. Designed to fight shortly before the queen bee.

Star construct
The boss is best described as an unholy, screaming mix of Golem, Planter, and a player who has just discovered grappling hooks, designed to fight around the same time as the world evil bosses (World Eater / Brain of Cthulhu). He sometimes falls from the sky while sleeping and can be awakened by hitting him multiple times, although the player can also summon him manually.

Esophage
A boss dedicated to both world disasters unlocks access to an alternate world evil after being defeated, designed to fight around the same time as Plantera. Surprisingly resembles a jumping spider.

Hemorrhage
A much more powerful version of Esophagus that fought during the Blood Moon. Since the original wasn't creepy enough, it has longer and thinner legs. Designed to fight after the golem.
